document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the Eurybrachidae XIV. The Australian genera Olonia Stål, 1862 and Stalobrachys gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of the Eurybrachidae XIV. The Australian genera Olonia Stål, 1862 and Stalobrachys gen. nov. (Hemiptera: Fulgoromorpha)

subSubSection.paragraph: urn:lsid:zoobank.org:act:26C5880F-0D15-409D-99C3- CA496382 C6FE
Figs 3 , 9–11
This species can be recognized by the following combination of characters:
(1) hind wings with conspicuous orange marking ( Figs 9E , 11E )
(2) pro- and mesofemora and tibiae largely brown ( Figs 9A–D , 11A–D )
(5) laterodorsal part of gonostyli with hooked process directed lateroventrally ( Fig. 10A, C–D ) (6) rather large size: 9.5–10 mm
This species is named after my son, Guillaume.

MEASUREMENTS AND RATIOS. LT: ♁ (n = 3): 9.9 mm (9.6–10.1); BV/LV = 4.15; BF/LF = 1.83; LP+LM/ BT = 0.66; Ltg/BTg = 2.5; LW/BW = 1.80.

Laterodorsal part of left gonostylus, dorsal view. E . Aedeagus, left lateral view. F . Aedeagus, dorsal view. Abbreviations: An = anal tube; G = gonostyli; Py = pygofer.

sp. nov. , paratype, ♀. A . Habitus, dorsal view. B . Habitus, ventral view. C . Habitus, lateral view. D . Habitus, normal view of frons. E . Posterior wing.

subSubSection.paragraph: ABDOMEN. Bright red with genital segments black-brown.

This species is currently recorded from a small area west of Mareeba in North Queensland ( Fig. 3 ), in the Einasleigh Upland Savanna bioregion. The specimens were collected in January, March, June, August and November; hence, the species may be present all year long.
